intro: Franseria tacorensis, commonly known as the Tacorensis Franseria, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves and clusters of small, fragrant, white or yellowish flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal potential, it is sometimes cultivated in horticultural settings.
